Description: Painted pottery daily life shabti with a curled lappet-wig, a modelled face with the eyes traced in black, a red and black collar, crossed hands in relief holding the crook and the flail, a white tunic with pleated sleeves and a triangular apron inscribed with two columns of black painted hieroglyphs; a fake(?).
Condition: fair - cracked around waist, paint worn
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
